meanings.meaning: 1. talk; speech; chat; conversation Only applies to 話, Only applies to 話し人の話に水を差さないでくれ。Don't throw a wet blanket over our conversation.
2. topic; subject 彼は不愉快な話を２時間もした。He dwelt on an unpleasant subject for two hours.
3. discussions; negotiation; argument Only applies to 話, Only applies to 話し３時間議論したが、我々は話がまとまらなかった。After three hours of discussion we got nowhere.
4. rumor; talk; hearsay 厳しい冬になるという話です。They say we are going to have a severe winter.
5. tale; story; fable 私はアンソニー卿のすばらしい話に夢中になっていました。I was lost in Sir Anthony's wonderful story.
6. circumstances; particulars 話を聞かせてくれ。I want a full report though.
話し 【はなし】、咄 【はなし】、噺 【はなし】
話し: Irregular okurigana usage. 咄: Rarely-used kanji form. 噺: Rarely-used kanji form.
1. counter for stories, episodes of TV series, etc.
1. talk; speech; chat; conversation Only applies to 話, Only applies to 話し人の話に水を差さないでくれ。Don't throw a wet blanket over our conversation.
2. topic; subject 彼は不愉快な話を２時間もした。He dwelt on an unpleasant subject for two hours.
3. discussions; negotiation; argument Only applies to 話, Only applies to 話し３時間議論したが、我々は話がまとまらなかった。After three hours of discussion we got nowhere.
4. rumor; talk; hearsay 厳しい冬になるという話です。They say we are going to have a severe winter.
5. tale; story; fable 私はアンソニー卿のすばらしい話に夢中になっていました。I was lost in Sir Anthony's wonderful story.
6. circumstances; particulars 話を聞かせてくれ。I want a full report though.
話し 【はなし】、咄 【はなし】、噺 【はなし】
話し: Irregular okurigana usage. 咄: Rarely-used kanji form. 噺: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: Don't throw a wet blanket over our conversation.
He dwelt on an unpleasant subject for two hours.
After three hours of discussion we got nowhere.
They say we are going to have a severe winter.
I was lost in Sir Anthony's wonderful story.
I want a full report though.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to talk; to speak; to converse; to chat ジョンはお客さんと電話で話した。John talked with his customer on the phone.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to tell; to explain; to narrate; to mention; to describe; to discuss あなたの趣味について話してください。Please tell me about your hobbies.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to speak (a language) 英語はカナダで話されている。English is spoken in Canada.
咄す 【はなす】
咄す: Rarely-used kanji form.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to discuss; to talk together
話しあう 【はなしあう】、話合う 【はなしあう】

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to discuss; to talk together
話しあう 【はなしあう】、話合う 【はなしあう】
1. discussion; talk; tête-à-tête; conference
話合い 【はなしあい】
1. discussion; talk; tête-à-tête; conference
話合い 【はなしあい】
1. to address (someone); to accost a person; to talk (to someone) 私はそんな失礼な話しかけられ方に慣れていない。I'm not used to being talked to in such a rude manner.
2. to begin to talk; to start a conversation 男が近づいて私に話しかけた。A man came up and spoke to me.
話し掛ける 【はなしかける】
1. to address (someone); to accost a person; to talk (to someone) 私はそんな失礼な話しかけられ方に慣れていない。I'm not used to being talked to in such a rude manner.
2. to begin to talk; to start a conversation 男が近づいて私に話しかけた。A man came up and spoke to me.
話し掛ける 【はなしかける】

sentences.translation: I'm not used to being talked to in such a rude manner.
A man came up and spoke to me.

meanings.type: Noun, Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no'
meanings.meaning: 1. art of conversation
1. speaker See also 聞き手
2. one who is skilled at speaking
1. way of talking; manner of speaking
話し振り 【はなしぶり】、話ぶり 【はなしぶり】
話ぶり: Irregular okurigana usage.
1. to be able to speak; to be able to talk See also 話すもう６ヶ月たてば流暢にドイツ語が話せるようになるでしょう。In another six months you will be able to speak German fluently.
2. to be understanding; to be sensible 彼女は話せる人だ。She has good sense.

sentences.translation: In another six months you will be able to speak German fluently.

meanings.meaning: 1. talkative person; gossip
話好き 【はなしずき】、話好 【はなしずき】
話好: Irregular okurigana usage.
1. to begin talking; to open up
話しだす 【はなしだす】
1. to begin to speak 話すことが多すぎて、どこから話し始めたらいいか分からない。There are so many things to tell you that I don't know where to start.

sentences.translation: There are so many things to tell you that I don't know where to start.
